humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has metastases in 2 out of a total of 16 lymph nodes (2/16). Based on the AJCC staging system, this corresponds to N1. This is in line with New Rule 12, which states that N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. The other rules do not apply to this report.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pN' component of the tumor classification, pN1a (2/16), indicates that there are metastases in 2 out of 16 lymph nodes examined. This corresponds to an N1 stage, as per the TNM staging system for cancer. The 'a' in N1a is a substaging factor and can be disregarded for the purpose of this question, which only asks for the N stage.
